Search
Advanced Search
Home
Research tools
Research tools
The Changes To Legislation search tool is a great way to discover how a piece of legislation has changed, and has been changed by, other legislation and the Advanced Search provides extra ways to find legislation by type, or by a range of years. You can now access judgments and decisions to see how legislation has been applied and interpreted in courts and tribunals by visiting the Find Case Law website.
Advanced search
Search for keywords in content, Welsh language legislation, legislation with specific geographical extent, and more.
Changes to legislation
A search tool to find all changes made to or by specific pieces or types of legislation.
Changes to Local, and Private and Personal Acts
Chronological lists detailing changes to Local, and Private and Personal Acts, between 1539 and 2008.
Find case law
Public access to court judgments and tribunal decisions is an essential part of interpreting legislation. Explore The National Archives’ Find Case Law service.
New site design
Help
About us
Site map

Section Navigation
Why we have changed the design
What has stayed the same
What improvements the new design brings
Back to top
Introducing our new legislation.gov.uk design
Why we have changed the design
The design of the legislation.gov.uk website has remained largely the same for the last decade, since its release. Over that period, desktop screens have got larger, technology has changed to allow us to present things in a clearer way, and design aesthetics have changed.
For some time you have been asking for a more up-to-date website, one that has a larger text size, to make it easier to read. We always listen to what you tell us and we have been working to make some changes to the website to accommodate your requests.
What has stayed the same
All of the legislation content and all of the functionality you are used to has stayed the same. The new design is purely that - a change to its appearance; everything works in the same way that you are familiar with.
Our website - whilst viewable on mobile devices - is not yet optimised for mob

EU Exit Arrangements

Revising legislation originating from the EU
Selecting legislation originating from the EU to publish on legislation.gov.uk
Citation, Numbering and Search
Back to top
EU legislation and UK law
The UK is no longer a member of the European Union. EU legislation as it applied to the UK on 31 December 2020 became part of UK domestic legislation under the control of the UK’s Parliaments and Assemblies, and is published on legislation.gov.uk. It is being kept up to date on legislation.gov.uk in the same way as other forms of domestic legislation. The information below will help you understand what we have published, and how to find the legislation you need.
Legislation originating from the EU published on legislation.gov.uk covers a wide range of subjects, from trade to travel. Changes to these laws may affect your business, family or personal circumstances. If you are looking for government
